intro: Jatropha dhofarica, commonly known as the Dhofar croton, is a flowering plant native to the Arabian Peninsula. It is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves and vibrant yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. Jatropha dhofarica is often found in rocky areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
